COURSES.name: Irrigation and Drainage Engineering
COURSES.description: Irrigation and drainage systems design, including pump sizing and specification, water distribution systems, plant water requirement, drainage systems and flood control.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ABE 3212C.

COURSES.name: Bio-Based Products from Renewable Resources
COURSES.description: Provides the knowledge for the production of fuels, chemicals, and materials from renewable resources; includes the fundamental principles and practical applications of bio-based products: biorefinery and biobased products overview, fundamental concepts in understanding biorefinery and biobased products; materials, chemical platforms, and fuels from biomass.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: (CHM 2045 or CHM 2095) and (CHM 2046 or CHM 2096) or equivalent general chemistry courses or instructor permission.

COURSES.name: Quantification of Biological Processes
COURSES.description: Quantitative description and analysis of biological processes pertaining to microbes, plants, animals and ecosystems. Biological transport phenomena, bioenergetics, enzyme kinetics, metabolism, bioregulation, circulatory and muscle systems, agroecosystems. Analytical and experimental laboratory for development of quantitative skills.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: (ABE 2062 or BSC 2010) and (EGN 3353C or CWR 3201).

COURSES.name: Food and Bioprocess Engineering Unit Operations
COURSES.description: Analysis of thermal freezing, evaporation, dehydration, contact equilibrium and mechanical separation processes as governed by the reaction kinetics and rheology of processed foods.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ABE 3612C or CWR 3201 or EGN 3353C.

COURSES.name: Individual Study in Biological Engineering: INDUSTRIAL HYGIENE
COURSES.description: Selected problems of projects in the student's major field of engineering study.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: recommendation of department chair.

COURSES.name: Individual Study in Biological Engineering: INDIVIDUAL STUDY
COURSES.description: Selected problems of projects in the student's major field of engineering study.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: recommendation of department chair.

COURSES.name: Integrated Product and Processing Design 1 in Biological Engineering
COURSES.description: First part of a two-course sequence in which multidisciplinary teams of engineering and business students partner with industry sponsors to design and build authentic products and processes on time and within budget.

COURSES.name: Writing Grant Proposals for Scholarships and Fellowships
COURSES.description: Introduces seniors in the Agricultural and Biological Engineering department to opportunities for obtaining scholarships, fellowships, internships, and teaching/research assistantships from federal funding agencies; includes funding sources and opportunities, provide guidelines for proposal writing. Requires preparing a proposal.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 2; Prereq: Senior standing, must be pursuing a degree within the Agricultural and Biological Engineering department, and instructor permission.

COURSES.name: Work Experience in Biological Engineering
COURSES.description: Work experience in the biological engineering industry with advisor approval. (S-U)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: Advisor approval

COURSES.name: Advanced Agricultural Process Engineering
COURSES.description: Engineering principles, processes, and techniques for using biological agents for production of chemicals, food, biofuels, and pharmaceuticals, and waste treatment.

COURSES.name: Biological Systems Modeling
COURSES.description: Introduction to concepts and methods of process-based modeling of biological systems; physiological, populational, and agricultural applications.

COURSES.name: Food and Bioprocess Engineering Design
COURSES.description: Engineering design of unit process operations employed in agro/food, pharmaceutical, and biological industries including sterilization/pasteurization, radiation, freezing, drying, evaporation, fermentation, distillation.

COURSES.name: Instrumentation in Agricultural Engineering Research
COURSES.description: Principles and application of measuring instruments and devices for obtaining experimental data in agricultural engineering research.

COURSES.name: Remote Sensing in Hydrology
COURSES.description: Develops practical understanding of remote sensing applications to hydrology using observations in different regions of the EM spectrum. Seminar style with emphasis on literature review and presentation.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ABE 6035.

COURSES.name: Nanotechnology in Water Research
COURSES.description: Applications of environmental nanotechnology to water quality control. Fate and transport of nanomaterials in hydrologic pathways.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: Basic knowledge of hydrology, environmental engineering, and water chemistry.

COURSES.name: Advanced Bio-Based Products from Renewable Resources
COURSES.description: Provides the knowledge for the production of fuels, chemicals and materials from renewable resources. The course includes the fundamental principles and practical applications of bio-based products: biorefinery and biobased products overview, fundamental concepts in understanding biorefinery and biobased products; materials, chemical platforms, and fuels from biomass.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: CHM2045 or equivalent, or instructor permission.

sections.note: This section requires some physical presence on campus in Gainesville.

COURSES.name: Seminar
COURSES.description: Preparation and presentation of reports on specialized aspects of research in agricultural engineering and agricultural operations management.

COURSES.name: Supervised Teaching
COURSES.description: Supervised Teaching

COURSES.name: Research for Master's Thesis
COURSES.description: Research for Master's Thesis

sections.note: This section is for students at the TREC
This section is for students at the SWFREC

COURSES.name: Advanced Research
COURSES.description: Research for doctoral students before admission to candidacy. Designed for students with a master's degree in the field of study or for students who have been accepted for a doctoral program. Not appropriate for students who have been admitted to candidacy.

sections.note: This section is for students at the SWFREC
This section is for students at the TREC

COURSES.name: Introduction to Managerial Accounting
COURSES.description: Accounting for cost reporting and control. Reports, statements and analytical tools used by management.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ACG 2021.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 10055 REQUIRES ONLINE PROCTORING. YOU WILL NEED A WEBCAM AND RELIABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET. LECTURES ARE RECORDED LIVE, AND ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE. FOR LECTURE RECORDING TIME AND LOCATION, GO TO HTTPS://WARRINGTON.UFL.EDU/UNDERGRADUATE-CURRENT-STUDENTS/VIDEO-LECTURES/.

COURSES.name: Business Processes and Accounting Information System
COURSES.description: Examination of the accounting information systems in a business organization. Coverage extends over topics such as business processes, internal controls, and the fundamentals of accounting information systems analysis, design, implementation and control.
COURSES.prerequisites:
Prereq: (ACG 2021 and ACG 2071 with minimum grades of B) and (CGS 2531 or ISM
3013).

COURSES.name: Supervised Accounting Internship
COURSES.description: Applied work in professional accounting. Requires several papers and reports. (S-U)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: advanced permission of accounting internship coordinator.

COURSES.name: Financial Accounting
COURSES.description: Introduction for prospective managers. Primary emphasis on financial reporting and analysis.

sections.note: This section meets 31-AUG-20 until 16-OCT-20. These dates may not include final examiniations.
This section meets 31-AUG-20 until 16-OCT-20. These dates may not include final examiniations.
This section meets 31-AUG-20 until 16-OCT-20. These dates may not include final examiniations.

COURSES.name: Managerial Accounting
COURSES.description: Introduction for prospective managers. Primary emphasis on management control systems.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ACG 5005.

sections.note: This section meets 26-OCT-20 until 11-DEC-20. These dates may not include final examiniations.
This section meets 26-OCT-20 until 11-DEC-20. These dates may not include final examiniations.
This section meets 26-OCT-20 until 11-DEC-20. These dates may not include final examiniations.

COURSES.name: Auditing I
COURSES.description: Concepts and theory underlying the audit of third party assertions. Coverage includes the audit environment, risk assessment, evidential search and evaluation, internal controls, audit programs and audit reporting.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 2; Prereq: ACG 4111 and ACG 4341 with minimum grades of C, senior standing, accounting majors only.

sections.note: Class Number 10073 is in Module 1. Classes meet from August 31 - October 16.  No official Final Exam Week.
Class Number 10074 is in Module 1. Classes meet from August 31 - October 16.  No official Final Exam Week.
Class Number 25608 is in Module 1. Classes meet from August 31 - October 16.  No official Final Exam Week.

COURSES.name: Issues in Audit Practice
COURSES.description: In-depth discussion of fundamental concepts underlying audit practice, including introduction to current topics in auditing, advanced audit methods, and trends in auditing practice.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ACG 5815, ACG 5226, 7AC standing.

sections.note: Class Number 25671 is in Module 2. Classes meet from October 26 - December 11.  Final Exam week is December  14-18.
Class Number 25672 is in Module 2. Classes meet from October 26 - December 11.  Final Exam week is December  14-18.
Class Number 27864 is in Module 2. Classes meet from October 26 - December 11.  Final Exam week is December  14-18.

COURSES.name: Individual Work in Accounting
COURSES.description: Reading and research in areas of accounting.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: approval of graduate coordinator.

COURSES.name: Principles of Advertising
COURSES.description: Overview of the concepts, strategies, and tactics of modern advertising. Explores the role of advertising in society, culture, and economics, as well as the industry and its key organizations. Introduces specific practices used to develop, place, and evaluate both traditional and digital ads.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: sophomore standing or higher.

COURSES.name: Cross Media Selling
COURSES.description: Students will explore traditional and digital media landscapes as well as the fundamental ways to create client-centered, holistic solutions using cross media platform selling. This course will deep dive into real-life examples and scenarios as well as give students hands-on experience with this type of selling.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ADV 3008 and MAR 3023 with minimum grades of C.

COURSES.name: Advertising Sales
COURSES.description: Principles of selling media time and space to advertisers. An overview of sales opportunities and challenges in the various advertising media. How to prepare and deliver effective sales presentations.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: MAR 3023 and ADV 3008 with minimum grades of C and junior standing or higher in ADV.

COURSES.name: Copywriting and Visualization
COURSES.description: Application of creative strategy/concepts, copywriting and design to the creation of advertising for traditional and nontraditional media. To evaluate and present creative work, create ads for multicultural audiences.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: 3JM ADV; minimum grades of C or better in ENC 3254, ADV 3001 and VIC 3001. Coreq: ADV 3500.

COURSES.name: Media Planning
COURSES.description: Provides an in-depth overview of the media planning process. Emphasizes the value of various media channels and evaluation methods to design innovative and integrated media strategies to reach and engage diverse audiences.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: 3JM ADV; minimum grades of C in ADV 3001 and ADV 3500.

COURSES.name: Advertising Undergraduate Research: ADV UNDERGRAD RES
COURSES.description: Mentored but self-directed work enables individuals or small groups to explore an issue of interest to them and to communicate their results to others. Depending on the topic, projects may involve inquiry, design, investigation, scholarship, discovery, or application.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ADV 3500 with a minimum grade of C.

COURSES.name: Advanced Advertising Internship
COURSES.description: A structured internship program that is approved by the department as an immersion experience related to the field of advertising. Requires 65 hours of work per credit hour and submission of electronic portfolio including a culminating project from the internship.
COURSES.prerequisites:
Prereq: 4JM ADV; 2.50 minimum professional GPA; minimum grades of C in ADV 3008, MAR
3023 and ENC 3254; and department permission.

COURSES.name: Economic Issues, Food and You
COURSES.description: The role of agriculture and economics: the how's and why's of their influence on food prices and the world food situation, the environment, natural resources and government policy; and economic issues, including inflation and money. (S)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: not for FRE majors.

COURSES.name: Introduction to Agricultural Computer Applications
COURSES.description: Introduces computer application with specific emphasis on applications used in agricultural businesses. Specific applications include spreadsheets, databases, word processing and DOS.

COURSES.name: Financial Planning for Agribusiness
COURSES.description: Introduces basic financial and managerial decision-making for small agribusinesses.

COURSES.name: Introduction to Agricultural Finance
COURSES.description: Basic financial statements, investment frameworks and theories of financial intermediation as applied to agricultural firms, along with an overview of financial institutions that provide capital to agriculture.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: AEB 3122 or ACG 2071.

COURSES.name: Agricultural Macroeconomics
COURSES.description: Introduces the world economy from a macroeconomic perspective that focuses on the links that arise from international trade and capital flows in the agricultural sector.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ECO 2013.

COURSES.name: Agricultural and Food Marketing
COURSES.description: Examines agricultural and food marketing from a system and individual firm perspective. Explores problems and issues associated with marketing functions and institutions at the industry level and with objectives and strategies of farms and agribusiness firms that market agricultural commodities and food products.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: AEB 3103 or AEB 2014 or ECO 2023 or ECO 2013.

sections.note: Class number 10141 is the section for on-campus students. Exams will be in-person in the evenings.

Dept controlled. Requires approval from FRE Undergraduate Academic Advising office. Class number 26669 is the section for off-campus students only. Exams will be done through ProctorU. High speed internet access and webcam required.

COURSES.name: Futures Markets and Risk Management in Agriculture
COURSES.description: Basic elements and principles of agricultural commodity marketing with emphasis on the futures industry. Includes use of futures markets for speculating and risk management for agriculture and finance. Participation in a computerized futures trading game is required.

COURSES.name: Selling Strategically
COURSES.description: Introduces professional selling techniques for all products with special emphasis given to food and agricultural products, technical systems and services.

sections.note: Class number 10142 is the section for on-campus students. Exams will be in-person in the evenings.

Class number 26646 is the section for off-campus students only. Section is department controlled. See an Advisor in the FRE Advising Office. Exams will be done through ProctorU. High speed internet access and webcam required.

COURSES.name: Agricultural Data Analysis in Food and Resource Economics
COURSES.description: Introduces analysis of agricultural data. Incorporates statistical and agricultural economic theory into the analysis of agricultural problems. Knowledge in use of spreadsheets is assumed.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: AEB 3103 and AEB 3510 and STA 2023.

COURSES.name: Comparative World Agriculture
COURSES.description: Studies the business and economic situations of the food and agriculture sector around the world. Focuses on the historical development, the current situation and the future outlook of the food and agriculture sector. (N and S)

COURSES.name: Agricultural and Natural Resource Ethics
COURSES.description: Examines the political, economic, environmental and ethical value issues involved in agricultural practices and policies, including agricultural research. (H or S) (WR)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: junior or senior standing.

COURSES.name: International Trade Policy in Agriculture
COURSES.description: Explores the role of international trade policy in agriculture and examines the effects of trade policies on domestic and international prices, consumption, production, trade and government revenues. Addresses impact of current trade issues on the agricultural sector. (S)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: AEB 3103 or ECO 2023.

COURSES.name: International Humanitarian Assistance
COURSES.description: Emergency assistance to developing countries to minimize losses and affect recovery. Includes legal/ethical bases; program designs promoting recovery, rather than dependence; cultural issues, including gender; and technical aspects. (N and S)

COURSES.name: Human Resources Management in Agribusiness
COURSES.description: Issues involved in the strategic and effective management of human resources in agribusiness. Human resource management concepts and techniques designed to improve agribusiness organizational teamwork, productivity, performance and enterprise success. Course explores the unique aspects of labor management and includes application through use of case problems, triad and video techniques.

COURSES.name: Special Problems in Food and Resource Economics
COURSES.description: Individual study in selected problem areas of interest to the student and agreeable to the instructor.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: instructor permission.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Food and Resource Economics: ADV AG MICROECONOMICS
COURSES.description: Lectures, conferences or laboratory covering specially selected topics in food and resource economics.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: instructor permission.
